newsitem.title: UK: UK shares edge higher, Wall St lends support.
newsitem.headline: UK shares edge higher, Wall St lends support.

text.p: British shares nudged higher at the outset on Monday, reassured by a firm close on Wall Street on Friday but with trading likely to remain quiet and cautious ahead of Wednesday's UK budget, dealers said.
The FTSE 100 was up 10.1 points at 4,652.1 by 0743 GMT, with gainers in a near three-to-one majority.

But participants said many major institutions were likely to be sidelined until after the budget, following weeks of speculation that Chancellor of the Exchequer (finance minister) Gordon Brown could hit the tax breaks that add to the appeal of shares for pension funds.
